title: Tbird 115.4.1 (64-bit) Default Column View keeps reverting
content:
I've had this problem since Supernova came out and it drives me nuts.

It has nothing to do with sorting or threading. I've read dozens and dozens of support threads about that. This problem has nothing to do with that.

Issue: There does not seem to be a way to force TB to use a default user-defined column view. The way *I* set up my columns is: Star/Attachments/From/Recipient/Thread/Subject/Received/Size. Other users will have their own preference on which columns to display in which order. I know I can change the displayed columns and replicate that to existing folders, cascading down for the account view. That's great.

However, whenever I create a new folder or change the name of a folder it will revert back to showing the columns TB used before. Same when I move a folder from one subfolder to another (which I suppose amounts to changing the name, in a way)

I wish there were a default I could set so that ANY new folder I create wherever in the account will have the same columns displayed. And that the columns displayed will stay the same when I change name of a folder.

I've also looked for an add-on that might accomplish this but could not find.
creator: rkuipers1

title: Text in body of email not showing, unless TB started in Troubleshoot Mode
content:
Many of my emails are now only showing the images (when allowed) but not showing the main text. I have cut the blank area from the text box and pasted it in a Word Pad doc to see that the text is actually there in the email but just cannot be seen by having the email displayed in Original HTML; it can be seen in Simple HTML or Plain Text. I disabled all add ons and set the theme to default to no avail. I have also tried disabling Hardware Acceleration without luck.

When I start TB in Troubleshoot Mode with or without the left side disable/reset options ticked, the emails can be seen correctly.
creator: agentfoxspookymulder

title: Some emails are being interpreted as future dated
content:
Thunderbird (115.7.0) is determining that "some" emails are future dated even though the mail-source is showing the email as dated today I am using the OWL add-on so that I came connect to Microsoft365

Here are the first few lines of mail-source as an example From - Wed Jan 31 2024 14:41:16 X-Mozilla-Status: 0001 X-Mozilla-Status2: 00000000 Received: from MEYP282MB1734.AUSP282.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM (2603:10c6:220:b7::16) 

by SYBP282MB2509.AUSP282.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM with HTTPS; Wed, 31 Jan 2024 01:41:15 +0000

Received: from SY5P300CA0008.AUSP300.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM (2603:10c6:10:1fb::10) 

by MEYP282MB1734.AUSP282.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM (2603:10c6:220:b7::16) with Microsoft SMTP Server (version=TLS1_2, cipher=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384) id 15.20.7249.23; Wed, 31 Jan 2024 01:41:13 +0000

I have added an image of the mail showing it as being dated tomorrow 01/02/2024 14:41

The "problem" emails are coming from a new Debian 12 server using mail.utils If I send an email from Debian 12 server using sendmail the emails are dated correctly However if I compare the mail-source of the mail.utils email versus the mail-source of sendmail email both show the same date and time

Thank you for you help

title: Thunderbird has started to ask for my Hotmail password all the time
content:
NOTE: Others have been pointed toward an incorrect answer from 2016 - this is not that issue

Have been using Thunderbird for a few years - with half a dozen emails on there - no issue.

About a week ago, the Hotmail account started to ask for my password almost all the time.

You re-enter your password and it still insists that it is needed (as if you have entered it incorrectly).

Clearing caches/rebooting/updating/Windows updates/deleting and re-adding the account etc - none of the 'standard fixes' change the issue.

I've changed my password - then opened Thunderbird again and get the same thing.

Login to server imap-mail.outlook.com with username <myaccount> failed. RETRY ENTER NEW PASSWORD CANCEL

This 'loops' - no matter if the password is 100% correct.

I can easily open a browser and log into my email with the same details - in a window next to the Thunderbird 'error' message... the password is not wrong.

PLEASE DO NOT LINK ME TO THE INCORRECT ANSWER FROM 2016 etc

I need an actual fix for 2024.

Any help/ideas - much appreciated!
creator: andrzejbania

title: Mail in arrivo che si eliminano da sole e poi ricompaiono
content: Buongiorno, da un po' di tempo succede questo: arrivano le mail nella casella posta in arrivo, le vedo, e poi improvvisamente si eliminano (in tempo reale mentre le sto leggendo)'. Questo noto che succede con le mail che contengono allegati (anche non pesanti). Riesco infatti a fare in tempo ad aprire gli allegati, ma la mail stessa si elimina, per poi ricomparire ore dopo (con lo stesso orario in cui è arrivata, quindi con un orario precedente rispetto a quando ricompare). Nessun altro cancella quella mail, nè nessuno fa nessun tipo di operazione. Come posso risolvere?

Microsoft Outlook is able to do that and it only makes sense for me.

Bug?

title: Maintaining Existing Window/Pane in "Write", "Reply", "Forward" and NOT activate New Window
content:
Dear TB Experts:

For nigh on 15 years of use of TB I have been able to reply to an email in the SAME Window as my directories and columnar list of emails from inbox, sent etc - i.e., the standard use window.

Unfortunately my wife who is an iPhone email user lost service yesterday and used my machine and TB to send an email with an attachment and has fat fingered or buggered up my settings and has caused TB to NOW launch a NEW WINDOW to reply to existing emails or even "write"/Compose a new email. See Attached screen shot of the new window problem

I have navigated through all the various General and Composition settings and cannot find a check box for SAME WINDOW.

Please advise as to how I can retrieve my OLD SAME WINDOW SETTING on reply, write etc.

Regards, Miles Conway.

title: New mail counter not resetting
content:
Regarding the counter of new mail messages in the red dot on the TB taskbar icon in Windows ...

I'm pretty sure the behavior used to be that I could open TB to the nified Inbox view and it would go to 0 (disappear).

Now it seems i have to go through every account inbox under the consolidated view in order to reset it.

Also, deleting an new unread message immediately to the trash (at least from the consolidated view) does not reset or decrement the new message counter in the taskbar; I think (or at least would expect) that "new" messages in Trash would not be counted as new.

Perhaps I'm wrong and the above has always been the behavior, but it feels different and wrong.

TB 115.7.0 64bit on Win 10 22H2.

I have to select another message then quickly go back to the message and quickly select Message Move and then scroll to the desired folder and hope it moves. title: You need to update Thunderbird - I need to be able to designate a different smtp/outgoing server setting for each email account
content:
I used to be able to use any of my logins for my email domain/provider for sending outgoing emails.

Now the account email used to authenticate the smtp client has to match the "from" for the emails. For the six email accounts that I currently am managing in Thunderbird, that means I have to go in to my account settings and change/verify a different outgoing email account every time I try to send an email message.

You need to change it so in each account setting, you can specify which smtp setting is used for that email account, instead of having smtp set up as a single, separate entity.

I have removed all add-ons, themes and linked calendars. Still it will only get the emails in troubleshoot mode. I am currently out of ideas and would very much like to have some input.


Thanks Tomme

title: Using Thunderbird creates very large files on hard disk
content: I have been using Thunderbird for about 5 yrs and I strongly prefer it to Outlook. However, my PC has a small solid state drive (128 GB) and Thunderbird is creating very large files. The first time this happened I uninstalled Thunderbird and then reinstalled it and picked up about 20 GB on the hard drive. I have always installed it with the standard selections. When space became short again, I started deleting or moving files and applications. I would free up 15 GB, but the next time I booted up, that space would be gone. Using WinDirStat, I found a folder in my Users/myname/appdata/roaming/Thunderbird that was 70GB, more than 1/2 my drive. As info, the total space used for email on the Gmail server was only 13GB. I uninstalled Thunderbird but only picked up a small amount of space. I manually deleted the Thunderbird folder and picked up 70 GB in storage. Outlook seems to have no such folder, I also learned that deleting an email message in my inbox folder does not delete it from my Important or from my All Mail folders and most importantly the Gmail server. I was suprised to find that the all mail folder on the server contained nearly 200,000 messages. The only way to delete them was going to gmail using a browser and deleting them directly on the server. I would like to return to Thunderbird if these problems can be resolved.
creator: lanejm47

title: email won't download from server
content: I'm using a Mac with OS 11.7.9, Thunderbird 115.7.0, my provider is Earthlink. There has been a problem recently where Thunderbird won't download my messages. I open Tbird, log in and the blue bar at the bottom stays on for a while then goes off, no email. If I hit the cloud button in the upper left corner of my Tbird window, it shows my email at the bottom of the screen, says downloading from host. It sometimes just shuts down, or will show how many messages there are to download and then shuts down, or shows the number of messages to download with the blue light bar at the right at the bottom of the page just scrolling without downloading the messages. Usually it just shows it has contacted the host, shows the number of messages it is going to download and just turns off in a few seconds. I tried clearing out messages from the Earthlink Webmail, in case there was a message causing the error, cleared a bunch of messages out of my Tbird inbox, deleted the messages built up in trash, cleared the caches of both Tbird and Firefox. I've used Tbird for years on the same computer I'm using now. Had this same problem a couple weeks ago, took a number of the same steps as per above, shut the computer down and restarted and Tbird was operating normally again until yesterday where the same problem started up again.
creator: gwingard
